result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan F Kircher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Ryan F Kircher in court with attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State files an Amended Information and defense acknowledges recipe of Amended Information.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, 2, 3. Court conducts plea colloquy. Court finds defendant guilty. Count 4 is dismissed and read in. Statement by M. K. 

Court orders the following:
Count 1
-  6 months Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED 68 days of credit if revoked. 
-  2 years Probation. 
- Court costs of $253.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge WAIVED
- Restitution of $1069.35 to be paid to the defendant's parents as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of Probation: Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  Defendant to obtain his GED. 

CONDITION TIME: 90 days WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - STAYED for 120 days Day Report Center. 

Count 2
-  6 months Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED Consecutive to Count 1
-  2 years Probation. 
- Court costs WAIVED
- DNA Surcharge WAIVED
- Conditions of Probation: same as Count 1

Count 3
-  6 months Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED Consecutive to Count 1 and Count 2
-  2 years Probation. 
- Court costs WAIVED
- DNA Surcharge WAIVED
- Conditions of Probation: same as Count 1
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Filed by R.B. in regards to the defendant's compliance with his bond conditions.

Defendant to reside with his sister.  Defendant to follow all household rules.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.    Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to report within 1 business day of release.  Defendant to continue to work towards obtaining GED.  Defendant to have no contact with his parents at their residence.

Defendant Ryan F Kircher in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin for Reisha Mitchell.   Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for defendant's Motion for Bail Modification.  Arguments by both counsel.  Court grant's defendant's motion for bail modification.  Court orders cash bond converted to a signature bond in the amount of $1,000.00.  Conditions to include:  Defendant to reside with his sister.  Defendant to follow all household rules.    Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.    Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to report within 1 business day of release.  Defendant to continue to work towards obtaining GED.  Defendant to have no contact with his parents at their residence.  Jury trial and jury status hearing to remain on the Court's calendar as previously scheduled.  Defendant updates address.
